# Description

`reset --force`  
does not delete releases

# Repro steps

```sh
$ helm list  # showing we have releases
NAME                	REVISION	UPDATED                 	STATUS  	CHART                   	NAMESPACE
curator             	1       	Tue Jan 16 13:30:08 2018	DEPLOYED	curator-0.1.0           	crons

$ helm reset
Error: there are still 15 deployed releases (Tip: use --force)
# as I user, I understand: OK, if I use --force, I will remove those helm releases

$ helm reset --force
Tiller (the Helm server-side component) has been uninstalled from your Kubernetes Cluster.

$ helm init  # reinstall helm, we should have an empty state

$ helm list
NAME                	REVISION	UPDATED                 	STATUS  	CHART                   	NAMESPACE
curator             	1       	Tue Jan 16 13:30:08 2018	DEPLOYED	curator-0.1.0           	crons
# The releases are still here?!
```

# Expected:

`helm reset --force` should delete release, and leave the cluster as if tiller had never been installed.

# Versions

```sh
$ helm version
Client: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.8.0", GitCommit:"14af25f1de6832228539259b821949d20069a222", GitTreeState:"clean"}
Server: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.8.0", GitCommit:"14af25f1de6832228539259b821949d20069a222", GitTreeState:"clean"}

$ uname -a
Darwin apollo 17.3.0 Darwin Kernel Version 17.3.0: Thu Nov  9 18:09:22 PST 2017; root:xnu-4570.31.3~1/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64 i386 MacBookPro11,3 Darwin
```
title: reset --force does not delete releases
